title.rendered: Incentive Travel London: Sustainable tours, travel and stays

acf.author: Cameron Williamson
acf.preview_text: Host your incentive group travel in London with our Corporate incentive travel planners. Motivate your employees with life changing experiences.

content.title: Introduction
content.content:
Meta: Host your incentive group travel in London with our Corporate incentive travel planners. Motivate your employees with life changing experiences.

London, with its rich history and vibrant culture, offers a world class destination for a bucket-list worthy incentive trip or business event.

Iconic landmarks on every corner – Buckingham Palace, Tower Bridge, Tate modern to name a few, and a thriving food and fashion scene, London truly has it all when it comes to topping the list of best incentive travel destinations

Add to this, the city leads the charge on sustainable travel and certification with its green tourism for London scheme – awarding business that are actively engaged in reducing the negative environmental and social impacts of their tourism operations.

So choose London for your incentive tour destination and reward your employees with unforgettable experiences while aligning your brand with a city dedicated to creating a better future.

content.title: Day 1
content.content:
Day 1

Morning: Arrive in London and check into an eco-friendly hotel such as The Zetter Hotel in Clerkenwell or The Savoy in Covent Garden – both sustainable hotels that prioritise energy efficiency, waste reduction, responsible sourcing and guest luxury and comfort.

Mid-Morning: Kickstart your London adventures with a popular eco tour – a guided walking tour of the city’s iconic landmarks, led by a knowledgeable local guide. Explore the historic streets of Westminster, marvel at the grandeur of Buckingham Palace, and take in the architectural wonders of the Tower Bridge and the Houses of Parliament.

Afternoon: Explore London’s rich cultural scene with a private group tour of the Tate Modern, one of the world’s leading contemporary art museums. Experience thought-provoking exhibits and engage in fascinating talks about art, sustainability, and social impact.

Evening: Mark your first evening in London with a memorable dining experience at The Ethicurean, a sustainable restaurant that champions seasonal and locally sourced ingredients. Delight in a farm-to-table feast, where every dish tells a story of ethical food practices and culinary craftsmanship.

content.title: Day 2
content.content:
Day 2

Morning: Head to the water and set sail on a Thames River cruise and view the city’s iconic landmarks from a different perspective. Sail past the Tower of London, Shakespeare’s Globe Theatre, and the majestic St. Paul’s Cathedral while learning about the river’s ecological importance and efforts to protect its ecosystem.

Afternoon: Enjoy a fascinating street art tour in the vibrant neighborhoods of Shoreditch and Camden. Explore the ever-evolving graffiti and mural art scene, led by passionate local guides who share the stories, meanings and community impact behind the artwork. This is a great way to engage with the dynamic street culture of London and witness how art can transform public spaces into thought-provoking urban galleries.

Early Evening: Next head to nearby Camden Town, a vibrant neighborhood known for its eclectic markets and street art. Explore the bustling stalls of Camden Market, sample international cuisine from local food vendors, host a team challenge amongst the market stalls, and soak up the vibrant atmosphere of this creative hub.

Late Evening: Conclude the day with an exclusive backstage tour and live performance at Shakespeare’s Globe Theatre, a reconstruction of the original Elizabethan playhouse. Experience the magic of Shakespearean theater and celebrate the enduring legacy of the world’s greatest playwright.

content.title: Day 3
content.content:
Day 3

Morning: Offer your team one of three eco-friendly activities – a private scenic cycling tour through the iconic landmarks of London exploring the city’s vibrant neighborhoods, picturesque parks, and historic sites. Or a thrilling adventure at Lee Valley White Water Centre, where white water rafting or kayaking will push your limits and build camaraderie. Or discover the world of sustainable fashion with a visit to the Fashion for Good Museum. Explore innovative and eco-friendly approaches to fashion design, production, and consumption, and learn about the importance of ethical fashion choices.

Afternoon: Next up, get out into nature with an afternoon at Kew Gardens, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a haven of biodiversity. Take in the remarkable landscapes, glasshouses, and diverse plant collections while gaining insights into conservation efforts and sustainable gardening practices. Enjoy an English picnic in the gardens with the backdrop of peaceful woodlands and dazzling fragrant rose bushes.

Early Evening: Treat your team to a farewell dinner at Silo, the world’s first zero-waste restaurant, renowned for circular, sustainable gastronomy (it doesn’t even have a bin!). Delight in a menu crafted from locally sourced, organic ingredients and observe true commitment to minimal waste and ecological responsibility in action.

Late Evening: Conclude your London incentive group travel experience with a rooftop celebration at the Sky Garden, an urban oasis offering panoramic views of the city’s skyline. Raise a glass to the memories made, the connections forged, and the sustainable learnings that have shaped this extraordinary journey together.

As your incentive travel experience comes to a close, take with you the inspiration, knowledge, and shared experiences that will empower your team to embrace community, sustainability and responsible practices in all aspects of life.

title.rendered: Incentive Travel Sydney: Sustainable tours, travel and stays

acf.author: Cameron Williamson
acf.preview_text: Plan incentive trips for employees to Sydney and inspire your team in our spectacular harbour city. Make it special with our Corporate incentive travel planners.

content.title: Introduction
content.content:
Meta: Plan incentive trips for employees to Sydney and inspire your team in our spectacular harbour city. Make it special with our Corporate incentive travel planners.

Inspire your team with an extraordinary 3-day incentive tour that showcases the very best of Sydney, from the stunning harbour to vibrant CBD and beyond.

Sydney, a world-class harbour city with natural beauty, iconic landmarks, and thriving cultural scene – ranks consistently highly for business events and incentive trips for employees.

Add to this Sydney is a leader in sustainable travel, tours and stays, so there’s no shortage of amazing group experiences for the modern day responsible traveller.

Explore the city’s iconic sights and hidden gems, indulge in delicious food and wine, and immerse yourselves in local art, culture and heritage in this 3-day Sydney incentive group travel itinerary like no other.

Let’s get started.

content.title: Day 1
content.content:
Day 1

Morning: Arrive in Sydney and check into an iconic harbourfront hotel. Travel sustainably with an eco hotel stay at the 5* Four Seasons Hotel Sydney for up to 530 guests, or boutique hotel Ovolo Woolloomooloo for up to 100 guests. Relax, settle in and enjoy the stunning views of Sydney harbour and the iconic Sydney Opera House.

Afternoon: Embrace the heart of Sydney with a private whale-watching tour on Sydney Harbour. Take in the sights of majestic humpback whales as they migrate along the east coast of Australia. Experience the thrill of seeing these magnificent creatures up close, and learn from expert guides about their behaviour and conservation.

Early evening: Return to your hotel and freshen up for a welcome drinks reception at Bennelong Restaurant, located under the iconic sails of the Sydney Opera House. Indulge in drinks and canapés while taking in sweeping Sydney harbour views.

Late evening: For an exclusive group experience tag on a surprise “behind the scenes” tour of the Sydney Opera house or after-hours guided tour of the Art Gallery of New South Wales, where you’ll receive an exclusive viewing of the gallery’s collection of Australian and international art.

content.title: Day 2
content.content:
Day 2

Morning: Immerse yourself in Sydney’s vibrant food scene with a guided food tour in the CBD. Explore hidden alleyways and discover local specialties while learning about the city’s history and culture. Sample delicious coffee, artisanal bread, cheese and chocolate.

Afternoon: After breakfast, take water taxis to Cockatoo Island, a UNESCO World Heritage site located in the middle of the Sydney Harbour. Explore the rich history of Cockatoo – a former convict prison turned shipyard built in the 1840s.

Take a guided tour of the island’s fascinating industrial heritage, bond over a thrilling team-building activity or host a unique conference or event onsite for up to 500 people with the stunning backdrop of Sydney harbour.

Early evening: Get ready for a once-in-a-lifetime experience: the Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. Strap on your harness and climb the iconic bridge together, taking in breathtaking views of the city skyline and the harbour below. The bridge climb is a top incentive travel event idea in Sydney and is a great way to bond with your colleagues, challenge yourselves.

Late evening: Celebrate with an exquisite gala dinner at award-winning Quay Restaurant, boasting panoramic views of the iconic Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Savor a multi-course menu by celebrated chef Peter Gilmore featuring the best of local Australian produce, paired with premium Australian wines.

content.title: Day 3
content.content:
Day 3

Morning: Head to the majestic Blue Mountains, 90-minutes from Sydney CBD, for an immersive Dharawal Aboriginal cultural experience. Explore ancient rock engravings, bush tucker, and natural medicines of the local indigenous people. Learn about aboriginal connection to the land and the rich, diverse history of the region.

Afternoon: Return to Sydney late afternoon for a relaxing beachside barbecue at picturesque Nielsen Park, one of Sydney’s most beautiful harbour beaches. Tuck into fresh, locally sourced prawns, oysters and crab, play fun beach games and take in the breathtaking views of the Sydney Harbour as the sun sets.

Evening: End the trip on a high note with a farewell cocktail event at rooftop venue – Zephyr Sky Bar. Located on the rooftop of the Hyatt Regency, the largest hotel in Sydney, you can be assured of premium services backed by sustainable business practices. Here you can enjoy panoramic views of the city skyline over signature canapes while reliving 3-days of unforgettable experiences shared with your team.

acf.author: Cameron Williamson
acf.preview_text: Discover Sydney as a sustainable destination for eco-friendly meetings and events.

content.title: Introduction
content.content:
Meta: Discover Sydney as a sustainable destination for eco-friendly meetings and events.

Sydney is a city that takes sustainability seriously and is committed to reducing its environmental impact. As a popular destination for business events and incentive programs, it has a range of sustainable tourism options that cater to the needs of environmentally conscious businesses and travelers.

content.title: Fast facts
content.content:
Fast facts

  • According to a survey by the Global Destination Sustainability Index, Sydney is the highest-ranked city in the Asia-Pacific region for sustainability, and the 10th highest-ranked city globally. The City of Sydney’s Sustainable Destination Partnership Program and NSW state Government Net Zero Plan set out a goal to reach zero emissions by 2050. To achieve this the city has implemented a range of initiatives to support their carbon reduction goals, including a target of sourcing 100% renewable energy for the city by 2030.
  • Sustainable Meetings and Events: Sydney has a wide range of green venues for meetings, incentives, conferences and events. A central sustainable venue for large business events in the city is the Sydney International Convention Centre. The ICC is a 6* rated, Gold LEED certified exhibition and event venue that delivers a range of environmentally and socially sustainable solutions including solar energy, plant based menus and food donations through OzHarvest.
  • Sustainable Tourism: Sydney is deeply committed to sustainable tourism, and has defined sustainable tourism as a strategic priority within the corporate values of Business Events Sydney and Tourism Australia. There are a wealth of eco tour options on offer in Sydney and surrounds from interpretive bushwalks in the World Heritage Listed Blue Mountains region, to Wildlife encounters and luxury conservation tourism in the picturesque Wolgan Valley. Sydney also has a range of eco-friendly accommodations that have implemented sound sustainability initiatives including reduced energy consumption, waste minimisation and local conservation efforts.
  • Aboriginal cultural experiences in Sydney not only provide opportunities for visitors to learn about Indigenous culture and traditions, but also support the economic development of local Indigenous communities.

 

In short, the city is strongly committed to making Sydney a sustainable destination for meetings and events.

title.rendered: Incentive Travel New Zealand: Eco tours, travel and stays

acf.author: Cameron Williamson
acf.preview_text: Host your incentive group travel in New Zealand with our Corporate incentive travel planners. Motivate your employees with life changing experiences.

content.title: Introduction
content.content:
Meta: Host your incentive group travel in New Zealand with our Corporate incentive travel planners. Motivate your employees with life changing experiences.

Explore our sample 4-day incentive trip to New Zealand, where breathtaking landscapes, natural wonders and true one-of-a-kind experiences await.

New Zealand is renowned for its pristine environments, diverse ecosystems, and deep-rooted Maori heritage. A New Zealand incentive group travel program brings awe-inspiring world heritage destinations, incredible adventures and rich engagement with local communities committed to preserving their land and traditions.

From the vibrant cityscape of Auckland to the enchanting fjords of Milford Sound, each day of our curated NZ incentive travel itinerary offers a unique blend of sustainable tours, ethical dining experiences, and opportunities to connect with the rich cultural tapestry of New Zealand.

By choosing eco-friendly accommodations, supporting local enterprises, and partnering with tour operators dedicated to conservation and community, this curated incentive tour will not only provide an unforgettable experience for your team but also contribute to the well-being and preservation of the places visited.

So join us on this remarkable New Zealand incentive trip and leave a lasting positive impact on both your team and the beautiful landscapes of New Zealand.

content.title: Day 1
content.content:
Day 1

Morning: Arrive in Auckland, New Zealand’s largest city, and check into an eco-friendly hotel such as Hotel DeBrett nestled in the heart of Auckland’s bustling CBD, or M Social Auckland located in the vibrant Wynyard Quarter. Both hotels effortlessly combine modern guest luxury with sustainable travel initiatives for a truly eco-conscious stay.

Late Morning: Venture to the waterfront and shake off the flight with a group guided kayaking tour along the picturesque coastlines and pristine waters of the Hauraki Gulf. Explore some of the gulf’s hidden gems from secluded beaches to fascinating rock formations. And get to know the local marine life from dolphins to seals, and a variety of seabirds.

Early afternoon: Take a short ferry ride from Auckland to Waiheke Island, a haven of vineyards, stunning beaches, and captivating landscapes. Enjoy a group guided tour of the island’s renowned wineries and soak up the relaxed island vibes and breathtaking views. Learn about organic and biodynamic viticulture practices, and sample local wines paired with locally sourced artisanal foods.

Evening: Mark the first day of your New Zealand incentive program with a welcome dinner at one of Auckland’s top restaurants, where farm-to-table dining takes center stage. Two outstanding restaurants for events and group bookings are The Grove – multi-award winning and renowned for their commitment to sourcing seasonal and locally grown produce. And Soul Bar & Bistro, a fun and lively venue serving up spectacular sunset views over Auckland’s thriving viaduct harbour.

content.title: Day 2
content.content:
Day 2

Morning: Head south for a full day of nature, beauty, movie sets and outdoor fun.

Mid Morning: Arrive at Hamilton Gardens and learn about the Story of Gardens at one of the region’s most visited attractions. Far from a conventional botanical garden, Hamilton Gardens invites you to step into another world and explore five garden collections from Fantasy to Tropical to Paradise, all spread over 58 spectacular hectares.

Early Afternoon: Satisfy your sweet cravings with a group high tea at New Zealand’s only tea plantation, Zealong Tea Estate. Crafted by passionate tea masters, Zealong tea is one of the purest teas in the world and is grown organically in the rich soil of the Waikato region. And with an impressive business events centre onsite catering up to 300 delegates you can create the perfect afternoon of tours, tastings and workshops.

Afternoon / Early Evening: Visit the Hobbiton Movie Set, the iconic filming location of The Lord of the Rings and The Hobbit trilogies, and enjoy a once-in-a lifetime experience in Middle‑Earth™ . Have the unique chance to see the Hobbiton Movie Set at dusk with a private guided evening tour through the Shire. As part of the tour your group can learn about the sustainable practices implemented on-site, including composting, water conservation, and ecological restoration.

Then enjoy a banquet dinner at the world-famous Green Dragon Inn inside of Hobbiton Movie Set.

Return to your Auckland hotel, or stay overnight at Rotorua and experience an immersive Maori cultural performance at Te Puia, a geothermal valley and Maori cultural center in Rotorua. Learn about Maori traditions, witness traditional song and dance performances, and gain insights into sustainable Maori practices.

content.title: Day 3
content.content:
Day 3

Day 3 takes us to Christchurch in New Zealand’s South island – a short 1.30 hr flight from Auckland.

Morning: Start your day with an adrenaline-pumping group activity either at Christchurch Adventure Park (CAP) – nestled in the picturesque Port Hills, or Adrenalin Forest – an aerial obstacle course nestled amidst the towering trees of Spencer Park. At CAP you can unleash your inner adventurers with a mountain biking experience on the park’s extensive network of trails, suitable for all skill levels. Or at Adrenalin Forest challenge your team with a series of thrilling rope bridges, flying foxes, and other high-wire adventures.

Afternoon: Balance out your adventure packed morning with a relaxing and rejuvenating afternoon at the Hanmer Springs Thermal Pools and Spa – a scenic alpine village a short drive from Auckland. Unwind in the naturally heated mineral pools, and enjoy the serene setting together, surrounded by snow-capped mountains and lush forests. For the adrenaline junkies amongst you – take a leap of faith at the Hanmer Springs Bungy Jumping site. Experience the ultimate thrill of freefalling from a platform suspended above a stunning river canyon.

Evening: For a casual venue with the best views of Christchurch, host your evening at Mr Brightside. A penthouse-style rooftop bar with a retractable roof, serving up 360-views over the Port Hills, Avon River, snow capped Alps, Cathedral Square and across the City (and the cocktails are to die for!). Or for a homely vibe with top-level pub grub and a cosy hygge a takeover of the Pomery’s old brewery inn comes highly recommended. With its ol’ English style pub charm and character it’s a beloved Christchurch institution perfect for an authentic Christchurch pub dinner.

If you have time….Squeeze in a stargazing experience in the Dark Sky Reserve of Lake Tekapo (~3-hrs south of Auckland). Learn about the importance of preserving dark skies, astronomy, and the cultural significance of the stars in Maori mythology.

content.title: Day 4
content.content:
Day 4

Morning: Set out early and journey to the West Coast to embark on a guided eco-tour of the Franz Josef Glacier or Fox Glacier. Learn about glacier conservation and the impacts of climate change in the region. And for the adventure seekers amongst you, get up close with the glacier with a heli-hike, guided ice walk or aerial sightseeing.

Afternoon: Take a scenic flight from Franz Josef across New Zealand’s highest mountains and largest glaciers to the breathtaking Milford Sound – a UNESCO World Heritage Site known for its stunning fjords. Jump on a scenic cruise and take in spectacular sights of native forest and cascading waterfalls while learning about environmental stewardship and the unique geological features of the area.

Evening: Journey back to Christchurch and mark the end of your New Zealand trip with a warm farewell dinner at renowned Christchurch restaurant Ortolana, showcasing the best of New Zealand’s locally sourced, sustainable cuisine. Share a farm-to-table dining experience together with seasonal, organic dishes inspired by Mediterranean and European flavors, and a Kiwi twist.

As your 3-day incentive trip to New Zealand comes to a close, take the time to reflect on the unforgettable experiences, captivating landscapes and life changing adventures that will leave a lasting impression on your team. And take heart in knowing your journey made a positive impact on local communities, and shared knowledge and education on responsible travel and exploration.

title.rendered: Incentive Travel Melbourne: Sustainable tours, travel and stays

acf.author: Cameron Williamson
acf.preview_text: Plan a Melbourne incentive tour with our Corporate incentive travel planners. Inspire your team for success with sustainable, eco-friendly travel and events.

content.title: Introduction
content.content:
Meta: Plan a Melbourne incentive tour with our Corporate incentive travel planners. Inspire your team for success with sustainable, eco-friendly travel and events.

Melbourne – the cultural, artistic, sporting (and coffee!) capital of Australia – is a vibrant and diverse destination for a one-of-a-kind group incentive trip for employees.

Offering a range of sustainable and green travel options, Melbourne also leads the way in eco-friendly accommodation, paddock to plate dining, coast to forest adventures and eco-tours.

And as Australia’s cultural mecca you can expect a vibrant arts scene, a dizzying spread of cuisines, iconic sporting events and buzzing local neighborhoods.

So let’s get started and explore our sample 3-day incentive tour in Melbourne.

content.title: Day 1
content.content:
Day 1

Morning: Arrive in Melbourne and kick start your incentive group travel experience with check-in to a sustainable hotel in the heart of the city. Be one of the first to stay at 1 Hotel, Seafarers, a nature-inspired hotel slated to open in 2024, with 280 rooms and a wellness centre, or the Pan Pacific Melbourne, conveniently located right next to the Melbourne Convention Centre and held up as one of the best practiced sustainable hotels in the city.

Afternoon: Embark on a guided street art tour in the famous laneways of Melbourne and  support local social enterprises through organisations like Everfresh Studio. Discover captivating murals and graffiti art created by local and international artists, and learn about the city’s thriving street art culture.

Early evening: Head to the Southbank precinct and enjoy a welcome dinner or cocktail events at one of Melbourne’s renowned riverside restaurants, such as Rockpool Bar & Grill –  one of Australia’s most awarded restaurants for fine dining and sustainable produce. Delight in a culinary journey featuring exquisite dishes crafted by acclaimed chefs, accompanied by fine wines or craft cocktails.

Late evening: Experience the magic of live performance at one of Melbourne’s iconic theaters. Attend a captivating show at the historic Princess Theatre – built in 1857 it’s the oldest surviving entertainment site in Australia and has played host to many of the world’s top musicals, operas, and shows. Or receive an exclusive after hours group tour at the contemporary Arts Centre Melbourne, and explore new experimental work designed to challenge conventional thinking and encourage new perspectives by leading Australian and international artists.

content.title: Day 2
content.content:
Day 2

Morning: Start the day early with a visit to Melbourne’s iconic Queen Victoria Market, a bustling marketplace offering a wide array of fresh produce, gourmet delicacies, and unique crafts. Explore the market’s diverse stalls, chat with local traders, cook up a delicious breakfast at a group cooking class or host a friendly competition to find the best local ingredients.

Mid-Morning: Head to the regions for a sustainable food and wine tour in the Yarra Valley – a renowned wine region just outside Melbourne. Visit award-winning sustainable wineries such as Yarrwalla Vineyard – famous for it’s cool climate Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, and Six Acres Wines – producer of a number of Gold Medal Award Winning Wines using organic and sustainable growing techniques. Sample a variety of wines, savor a delectable lunch at a vineyard restaurant and learn all about the art of organic winemaking from local experts.

For non-drinkers there’s plenty to enjoy outside of the cellar doors – enjoy cheese tasting at the Yarra Valley Dairy, get lost in the 1.2km Hedgend Maze, or soak up the stunning landscapes of the Yarra Ranges National Park.

Evening: Enjoy a memorable dinner at one of Melbourne’s hidden gem restaurants, such as Attica or Vue de Monde. These acclaimed establishments offer exceptional culinary experiences, featuring innovative dishes prepared with locally sourced ingredients and a true commitment to authentic, sustainable and ethical cooking techniques.

content.title: Day 3
content.content:
Day 3

Morning: Venture to the picturesque Mornington Peninsula, known for its stunning coastal landscapes and renowned wineries. For a serene and uplifting start to the day embark on a scenic hot air balloon flight over the region, taking in breathtaking views of vineyards, beaches, and rolling hills.

Afternoon: Visit the charming seaside town of Sorrento and enjoy a relaxing afternoon at the Peninsula Hot Springs. Relax and rejuvenate your senses in the outdoor thermal baths and breathe deeply into the tranquil surroundings and picturesque coastal views.

Evening: Return to Melbourne CBD and conclude the trip with a farewell gala dinner at an exclusive waterfront restaurant such as The Stokehouse – everyone’s favourite beachfront restaurant at St Kilda. Delight in a menu showcasing the finest local seafood and seasonal produce, paired with exquisite wines. Raise a toast to the success of the incentive trip and the special memories created with your team.
